Is a string a GWAS Catalog study accession ID?

Source: R/parse-utils.R
is_study_id.Rd

Find which strings are valid GWAS Catalog study accession IDs (returns TRUE). Study accession IDs are tested against the following regular expression: ^GCST\\d{6}$.

is_study_id(str, convert_NA_to_FALSE = TRUE)

Arguments

str

A character vector of strings.
convert_NA_to_FALSE

Whether to treat NA as NA (convert_NA_to_FALSE = FALSE) or whether to return FALSE when an NA is found (convert_NA_to_FALSE = TRUE).

Value

A logical vector.

Examples

# Can "GCST123456" be a valid GWAS Catalog study accession ID?
is_study_id("GCST123456") # TRUE
#> [1] TRUE

# Test a bunch of strings:
is_study_id(
  c("GCST123456", "GCST000042", "123456")) # TRUE TRUE FALSE
#> [1]  TRUE  TRUE FALSE

# By default NAs are returned as they are.
is_study_id(
  c("123456", "GCST123456", NA_character_)) # FALSE TRUE NA
#> [1] FALSE  TRUE FALSE

# Use the argument convert_NA_to_FALSE = TRUE to get FALSE instead of NA.
is_study_id(c("123456", "GCST123456", NA_character_),
                   convert_NA_to_FALSE = TRUE) # FALSE TRUE FALSE
#> [1] FALSE  TRUE FALSE

Contents

  • Value
